result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamillia Marie Brown

records.addlTxt: Defendant has two other pending cases set before Judge Watts, Branch 15. Branch 15 is willing to take the cases from Branch 30 for a global resolution.

Court allowing time for Defendant to appear for book and release.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 10-23-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Pre-trial conference on November 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Due to Court being down 10/7/2022, the 10/7/2022 pretrial conference is rescheduled to 11/4/2022 at 1:30 p.m. by zoom defendant notified via notice of hearing.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Target locations.

Defendant Jamillia Marie Brown in court. Prosecuting attorney Abigail Doweiko in court under the student practice rule, under the supervision of Tom Potter who is available by phone, for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/16/22 @ 2p
